lines.en: I arrive in Bahia, I eat acarajé
I eat shrimp, I eat vatapá

lines.br: Cosme e Damião com seu caruru
Capoeira no domingo é la na Humaitá
lines.en: Capoeira on Sunday is there in Humaitá

lines.br: Subo o Curuzu só pra ver ilê
lines.en: I climb Curuzu, just to see ilê
I ask for protection from my orixás

lines.br: Praça Cayru na boca da noite
Chego na Bahia roda de terreiro
lines.en: Arrive in Bahia, Roda of the ground

lines.br: Chego na Bahia roda o ano inteiro
lines.en: Arrive in Bahia, roda the whole year round

details.desc: A traditional food from Bahia - deep fried fritta usually filled with vatapá and shrimps
A traditional food from Bahia - a paste made of shrimps and peanuts
Gods of the candomblé religion which first arose in the slave population of Brazil
A lift in Salvador, Bahia that links the low city and the high city
A famous artisan market in Salvador, Bahia
The square outside the Mercado Modelo in Salvador
Cosmas and Damian were two Arab physicians and early Christian martyrs, they are the saints of doctors and pharmacists
